thread.title: What’s on TV this week — the seven shows you can’t miss
thread.title_full: What’s on TV this week — the seven shows you can’t miss

author: Shannon Molloy
title: What’s on TV this week — the seven shows you can’t miss
text:
Video Image Gruen is back - trailer 0:30 Gruen: the show that knows nearly as much about advertising as advertisers know about you, is back! ABC TV
January 1st 1970 46 years ago /video/video.news.com.au/Entertainment/ Top picks ... the best of what’s on the box this week. Picture: Supplied
Shannon Molloy News Corp Australia ACROSS the free-to-air channels, subscription television and streaming networks there are hundreds of options each week when it comes to what to watch.
Here’s a collection of the best of the small screen each day for the next week, from drama and documentaries to reality TV and game shows.
And there are a few trashy options thrown in too.
New season ... Marta Dusseldorp and Abby Earl return with the rest of the cast for the third season of A Place To Call Home. Picture: Nick Wilson Source: Foxtel
A PLACE TO CALL HOME
The anticipated new season of this much-loved Aussie period drama kicks off with a bang — lives are on the line in more ways than one. It sets the tone for what’s to come for the Bligh family, Sarah Adams and the many other characters. I just love this show — it’s got a strong cast, high production values and meaty storylines.
DAVID BERRY PORTRAYS A GAY MAN’S LIFE IN THE FIFTIES
MARTA DUSSELDORP HAUNTED BY HER CHARACTER
Sunday, 8.30pm, SoHo
Honourable mention for guilty pleasure viewing goes to If You Are The One at 7.30pm on SBS2. This Chinese dating panel show has a huge cult following for a reason — it’s fantastic.
Quiz master ... Tom Gleisner from Have You Been Paying Attention. Picture: Channel 10 Source: Supplied
HAVE YOU BEEN PAYING ATTENTION?
This Tom Gleisner-fronted quiz show takes a look at the week of news and current affairs through the prism of humour. If you’re out of the loop with what’s been happening in the world, this is a fun way of catching up.
TOM GLEISNER ON HOW HUBPA IS CHANGING
TOM GLEISNER SHOWS OFF HIS HOME
Monday, 8.30pm, Ten
Honourable mention for guilty pleasure viewing goes to Cats Uncovered: The Lion In Your Lap at 7.30pm on SBS. GPS trackers and ‘cat cams’ reveal what felines really get up to.
Hot drama ... Erik Thomson for 800 Words. Picture: Supplied Source: Channel 7
800 WORDS
It’s official — Australia is in love with this cracker new drama, about an Aussie dad and his two kids starting over in smalltown New Zealand. The transition isn’t always smooth, as seen in tonight’s episode. Light, charming and beautifully shot — this show’s worth a look.
ERIK THOMSON ON IMPORTANCE OF HIS 800 WORDS KIDS
‘CRAFTERNOONS’: HOW 800 WORDS STARLET BONDED WITH CAST
Tuesday, 8.45pm, Seven
Honourable mention for guilty pleasure viewing goes to Bondi Ink Tattoo at 8.30pm on Eleven. The final episode of this ob-doc about a Sydney tattoo studio.
Inside look ... Wil Anderson hosts Gruen, a show about advertising. Source: Supplied
GRUEN
Wil Anderson hosts this hilarious and fascinating examination of the world of advertising and how we’re sold everything from dog food to political policies. There are plenty of “f*** me” moments, as he calls them, in each episode — little realisations you never knew about things in plain sight.
WIL ANDERSON: ‘NEVER HAD AN INTEREST IN ADVERTISING’
GRUEN REVIEW WOOLWORTHS’ WITHDRAWN ANZAC CAMPAIGN
Wednesday, 8.30pm, ABC
Honourable mention for guilty pleasure viewing goes to Caught On Dashcam at 7.30pm on Seven. A video clip show about the stuff caught on video from inside moving vehicles.
Hilarious ... Gogglebox is the show about people watching TV and it’s brilliant, pure and simple. Source: Supplied
GOGGLEBOX
One of the surprise highlights of TV this year, in my opinion, is this show about people watching television — which I thought I’d hate. As it turned out, it’s strangely intriguing and enjoyable viewing. And now it’s back for a second instalment.
THE DALTONS: WHAT IT’S LIKE TO BE ON GOGGLEBOX
NO SURPRISE; WHY GOGGLEBOX IS COMING BACK
Thursday, 8.30pm, Ten
Honourable mention for guilty pleasure viewing goes to Kings Cross ER at 7.30pm on Nine. I love these fly on the wall ob-docs, particularly about the goings-on of a very busy Sydney hospital.
Good chat ... Graham Norton hosts perhaps the best chat show in the world. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied
THE GRAHAM NORTON SHOW
He’s the king of chat shows, with a slew of big name celebrity and musical guests each week. It’s always insightful and often side-splitting funny. It’s worth staying in for on a Friday night. Tonight he’s joined by Hollywood megastar Matt Damon.
GRAHAM NORTH: ‘AUSSIES ARE MY SECOND-HAND AUDIENCE’
FOLLOW GRAHAM NORTON ON TWITTER
Friday, 8.30pm, Ten
Honourable mention for guilty pleasure viewing goes to Celebrity Rehab with Dr Drew at 11.05pm on ABC2. Stars battling addiction seek help.
Gripping film ... Hotel Rwanda is the true story of Paul Rusesabaginba — a hero in the midst of utter chaos. Source: Supplied
HOTEL RWANDA
Saturday nights are all about movies on TV and this one is brilliant. It’s the true story of a hotel manager in Rwanda who tries to save the lives of refugees by sheltering them at work. A moving story, to say the least.
BEST 100 FILMS OF NOUGHTIES
WHAT TO SEE AT THE MOVIES
Saturday, 8.35pm, SBS
Honourable mention for guilty pleasure viewing goes to Hell’s Kitchen USA at 9.30pm on Lifestyle. Think MasterChef but much more intense, overseen by foul-mouthed British chef Gordon Ramsay.
JOIN THE CONVERSATION. What’s your favourite show on television at the moment? Share your picks in the comments module below.
Originally published as Seven TV shows you should consider
